title.narrative: COVID19:CHILD POVERTY - IMPLEMENTATION

description.narrative: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Health, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Immunization, Learning Outcomes, Maternal And Newborn Health, Maternal And Newborn Health (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN Place(Annex) Matsitama Road P O Box 20678 Gaborone

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)

Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Botswana fully implements policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals andtargets and national aspirations.

description.narrative: Risk communication, advocacy and partnership efforts by UNICEF contributed to high-level results particularly ondata and evidence generation (U-Report polls and rumour tracking, etc.), to address amongst others, vaccine hesitancy among eligible populations through community dialogues and engagement of various key various stakeholders.Over 25,000 caregivers and children reached with COVID-19 prevention and vaccine messaging with a further 13,684 reached with messages on prevention of violence against children. Continuity of learning supported through psychosocial support benefiting 6,800 learners and 2,750 teachers. Over, 1,800,000 doses of COVID-19 vaccines delivered to reduce COVID-19 morbidity and mortality. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/12/2021
